alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 5:06PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Graham. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Long Hollow, Fourmile Creek, Squaw Creek, Black Rock Wash, Oak Creek, Aravaipa Creek, Kennedy Falls Wash, Crazy Horse Wash, Bigler Wash, Deer Creek, Rattlesnake Creek, Klondyke Wash and Underwood Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Klondyke. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
